entities.name: harry potter
entities.description: The Prime Minister is talking about Harry Potter as a powerful wizard who has eluded capture for almost three decades. ("...one of the most powerful wiz-ards of all time, a wizard who has eluded capture for almost three decades!")

entities.name: fudge
entities.description: Fudge is the Minister who is being questioned by the Prime Minister about his handling of the blackmailer. ("My fault!" said Fudge, colouring up.)

entities.name: prime minister
entities.description: The Prime Minister is a government official who is questioning Fudge about his handling of the blackmailer. ("said the Prime Minister furiously.")

relationships.description: The Prime Minister is questioning Fudge about his handling of the blackmailer. ("My fault!" said Fudge, colouring up.)
The Prime Minister is accusing Fudge of not doing enough to catch the blackmailer. ("Are you saying you would have caved in to blackmail like that?" said the Prime Minister.)

The Prime Minister is concerned about Harry Potter, who has eluded capture for almost three decades. ("So I suppose you're going to tell me he caused the hurricane in the West Country, too?" said the Prime Minister.)
